intro: Bartholina, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the genus Saintpaulia and is characterized by its velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and prefers well-draining soil. Bartholina is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. It produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of purple, white, and pink.
